author: Genesis 1:1
text: In the beginning God created the heaven and the earth.

author: Psalm 23:1
text: The Lord is my shepherd; I shall not want.

author: John 3:16
text: For God so loved the world, that he gave his only begotten Son, that whosoever believeth in him should not perish, but have everlasting life.

author: Philippians 4:13
text: I can do all things through Christ which strengtheneth me.

author: Romans 8:28
text: And we know that all things work together for good to them that love God, to them who are the called according to his purpose.

author: Proverbs 3:5
text: Trust in the Lord with all thine heart; and lean not unto thine own understanding.

author: Proverbs 3:6
text: In all thy ways acknowledge him, and he shall direct thy paths.

author: Matthew 6:33
text: But seek ye first the kingdom of God, and his righteousness; and all these things shall be added unto you.

author: Psalm 119:105
text: Thy word is a lamp unto my feet, and a light unto my path.

author: Isaiah 40:31
text: But they that wait upon the Lord shall renew their strength; they shall mount up with wings as eagles; they shall run, and not be weary; and they shall walk, and not faint.

author: Joshua 1:9
text: Have not I commanded thee? Be strong and of a good courage; be not afraid, neither be thou dismayed: for the Lord thy God is with thee whithersoever thou goest.

author: Hebrews 11:1
text: Now faith is the substance of things hoped for, the evidence of things not seen.

author: Jeremiah 29:11
text: For I know the thoughts that I think toward you, saith the Lord, thoughts of peace, and not of evil, to give you an expected end.

author: Romans 12:2
text: And be not conformed to this world: but be ye transformed by the renewing of your mind, that ye may prove what is that good, and acceptable, and perfect, will of God.

author: Philippians 4:6
text: Be careful for nothing; but in every thing by prayer and supplication with thanksgiving let your requests be made known unto God.

author: Philippians 4:7
text: And the peace of God, which passeth all understanding, shall keep your hearts and minds through Christ Jesus.

author: 1 Corinthians 13:4
text: Charity suffereth long, and is kind; charity envieth not; charity vaunteth not itself, is not puffed up,

author: 1 Corinthians 13:13
text: And now abideth faith, hope, charity, these three; but the greatest of these is charity.

author: Matthew 28:19
text: Go ye therefore, and teach all nations, baptizing them in the name of the Father, and of the Son, and of the Holy Ghost:

author: Matthew 28:20
text: Teaching them to observe all things whatsoever I have commanded you: and, lo, I am with you alway, even unto the end of the world. Amen.

author: Galatians 5:22
text: But the fruit of the Spirit is love, joy, peace, longsuffering, gentleness, goodness, faith,

author: Galatians 5:23
text: Meekness, temperance: against such there is no law.

author: Ephesians 2:8
text: For by grace are ye saved through faith; and that not of yourselves: it is the gift of God:

author: Ephesians 2:9
text: Not of works, lest any man should boast.

author: John 14:6
text: Jesus saith unto him, I am the way, the truth, and the life: no man cometh unto the Father, but by me.

author: John 10:10
text: The thief cometh not, but for to steal, and to kill, and to destroy: I am come that they might have life, and that they might have it more abundantly.

author: Psalm 46:1
text: God is our refuge and strength, a very present help in trouble.

author: Psalm 46:10
text: Be still, and know that I am God: I will be exalted among the heathen, I will be exalted in the earth.

author: 2 Timothy 1:7
text: For God hath not given us the spirit of fear; but of power, and of love, and of a sound mind.

author: Isaiah 41:10
text: Fear thou not; for I am with thee: be not dismayed; for I am thy God: I will strengthen thee; yea, I will help thee; yea, I will uphold thee with the right hand of my righteousness.

author: 1 Peter 5:7
text: Casting all your care upon him; for he careth for you.

author: Hebrews 13:8
text: Jesus Christ the same yesterday, and to day, and for ever.

author: James 1:5
text: If any of you lack wisdom, let him ask of God, that giveth to all men liberally, and upbraideth not; and it shall be given him.

author: James 4:7
text: Submit yourselves therefore to God. Resist the devil, and he will flee from you.

author: James 4:8
text: Draw nigh to God, and he will draw nigh to you.

author: Revelation 21:4
text: And God shall wipe away all tears from their eyes; and there shall be no more death, neither sorrow, nor crying, neither shall there be any more pain: for the former things are passed away.

author: Micah 6:8
text: He hath shewed thee, O man, what is good; and what doth the Lord require of thee, but to do justly, and to love mercy, and to walk humbly with thy God?

author: Romans 3:23
text: For all have sinned, and come short of the glory of God;

author: Romans 6:23
text: For the wages of sin is death; but the gift of God is eternal life through Jesus Christ our Lord.

author: Romans 5:8
text: But God commendeth his love toward us, in that, while we were yet sinners, Christ died for us.

author: Romans 10:9
text: That if thou shalt confess with thy mouth the Lord Jesus, and shalt believe in thine heart that God hath raised him from the dead, thou shalt be saved.

author: Romans 10:13
text: For whosoever shall call upon the name of the Lord shall be saved.

author: 1 John 1:9
text: If we confess our sins, he is faithful and just to forgive us our sins, and to cleanse us from all unrighteousness.

author: 1 John 4:8
text: He that loveth not knoweth not God; for God is love.

author: 1 John 4:19
text: We love him, because he first loved us.

author: Matthew 5:3
text: Blessed are the poor in spirit: for theirs is the kingdom of heaven.

author: Matthew 5:4
text: Blessed are they that mourn: for they shall be comforted.

author: Matthew 5:5
text: Blessed are the meek: for they shall inherit the earth.

author: Matthew 5:6
text: Blessed are they which do hunger and thirst after righteousness: for they shall be filled.

author: Matthew 5:7
text: Blessed are the merciful: for they shall obtain mercy.

author: Matthew 5:8
text: Blessed are the pure in heart: for they shall see God.

author: Matthew 5:9
text: Blessed are the peacemakers: for they shall be called the children of God.

author: Matthew 5:14
text: Ye are the light of the world. A city that is set on an hill cannot be hid.

author: Matthew 5:16
text: Let your light so shine before men, that they may see your good works, and glorify your Father which is in heaven.

author: Matthew 11:28
text: Come unto me, all ye that labour and are heavy laden, and I will give you rest.

author: Matthew 11:29
text: Take my yoke upon you, and learn of me; for I am meek and lowly in heart: and ye shall find rest unto your souls.

author: Matthew 22:37
text: Jesus said unto him, Thou shalt love the Lord thy God with all thy heart, and with all thy soul, and with all thy mind.

author: Matthew 22:39
text: And the second is like unto it, Thou shalt love thy neighbour as thyself.

author: Mark 10:27
text: And Jesus looking upon them saith, With men it is impossible, but not with God: for with God all things are possible.

author: Mark 11:24
text: Therefore I say unto you, What things soever ye desire, when ye pray, believe that ye receive them, and ye shall have them.

author: Luke 1:37
text: For with God nothing shall be impossible.

author: Luke 6:31
text: And as ye would that men should do to you, do ye also to them likewise.

author: John 1:1
text: In the beginning was the Word, and the Word was with God, and the Word was God.

author: John 1:14
text: And the Word was made flesh, and dwelt among us, (and we beheld his glory, the glory as of the only begotten of the Father,) full of grace and truth.

author: John 8:32
text: And ye shall know the truth, and the truth shall make you free.

author: John 11:25
text: Jesus said unto her, I am the resurrection, and the life: he that believeth in me, though he were dead, yet shall he live:

author: John 14:1
text: Let not your heart be troubled: ye believe in God, believe also in me.

author: John 14:27
text: Peace I leave with you, my peace I give unto you: not as the world giveth, give I unto you. Let not your heart be troubled, neither let it be afraid.

author: John 15:5
text: I am the vine, ye are the branches: He that abideth in me, and I in him, the same bringeth forth much fruit: for without me ye can do nothing.

author: John 15:13
text: Greater love hath no man than this, that a man lay down his life for his friends.

author: Acts 1:8
text: But ye shall receive power, after that the Holy Ghost is come upon you: and ye shall be witnesses unto me both in Jerusalem, and in all Judaea, and in Samaria, and unto the uttermost part of the earth.

author: Acts 4:12
text: Neither is there salvation in any other: for there is none other name under heaven given among men, whereby we must be saved.

author: Acts 16:31
text: And they said, Believe on the Lord Jesus Christ, and thou shalt be saved, and thy house.

author: Romans 1:16
text: For I am not ashamed of the gospel of Christ: for it is the power of God unto salvation to every one that believeth; to the Jew first, and also to the Greek.

author: Romans 8:1
text: There is therefore now no condemnation to them which are in Christ Jesus, who walk not after the flesh, but after the Spirit.

author: Romans 8:31
text: What shall we then say to these things? If God be for us, who can be against us?

author: Romans 8:37
text: Nay, in all these things we are more than conquerors through him that loved us.

author: Romans 8:38
text: For I am persuaded, that neither death, nor life, nor angels, nor principalities, nor powers, nor things present, nor things to come,

author: Romans 8:39
text: Nor height, nor depth, nor any other creature, shall be able to separate us from the love of God, which is in Christ Jesus our Lord.

author: Romans 12:1
text: I beseech you therefore, brethren, by the mercies of God, that ye present your bodies a living sacrifice, holy, acceptable unto God, which is your reasonable service.

author: Romans 12:21
text: Be not overcome of evil, but overcome evil with good.

author: 1 Corinthians 10:13
text: There hath no temptation taken you but such as is common to man: but God is faithful, who will not suffer you to be tempted above that ye are able; but will with the temptation also make a way to escape, that ye may be able to bear it.

author: 1 Corinthians 15:58
text: Therefore, my beloved brethren, be ye stedfast, unmoveable, always abounding in the work of the Lord, forasmuch as ye know that your labour is not in vain in the Lord.

author: 1 Corinthians 16:14
text: Let all your things be done with charity.

author: 2 Corinthians 5:7
text: (For we walk by faith, not by sight:)

author: 2 Corinthians 5:17
text: Therefore if any man be in Christ, he is a new creature: old things are passed away; behold, all things are become new.

author: 2 Corinthians 12:9
text: And he said unto me, My grace is sufficient for thee: for my strength is made perfect in weakness. Most gladly therefore will I rather glory in my infirmities, that the power of Christ may rest upon me.

author: Galatians 2:20
text: I am crucified with Christ: nevertheless I live; yet not I, but Christ liveth in me: and the life which I now live in the flesh I live by the faith of the Son of God, who loved me, and gave himself for me.

author: Galatians 6:9
text: And let us not be weary in well doing: for in due season we shall reap, if we faint not.

author: Ephesians 4:32
text: And be ye kind one to another, tenderhearted, forgiving one another, even as God for Christ's sake hath forgiven you.

author: Philippians 1:6
text: Being confident of this very thing, that he which hath begun a good work in you will perform it until the day of Jesus Christ:

author: Philippians 4:8
text: Finally, brethren, whatsoever things are true, whatsoever things are honest, whatsoever things are just, whatsoever things are pure, whatsoever things are lovely, whatsoever things are of good report; if there be any virtue, and if there be any praise, think on these things.

author: Philippians 4:19
text: But my God shall supply all your need according to his riches in glory by Christ Jesus.

author: Colossians 3:23
text: And whatsoever ye do, do it heartily, as to the Lord, and not unto men;

author: 1 Thessalonians 5:16
text: Rejoice evermore.

author: 1 Thessalonians 5:17
text: Pray without ceasing.

author: 1 Thessalonians 5:18
text: In every thing give thanks: for this is the will of God in Christ Jesus concerning you.

author: 2 Timothy 3:16
text: All scripture is given by inspiration of God, and is profitable for doctrine, for reproof, for correction, for instruction in righteousness:

author: Hebrews 4:12
text: For the word of God is quick, and powerful, and sharper than any twoedged sword, piercing even to the dividing asunder of soul and spirit, and of the joints and marrow, and is a discerner of the thoughts and intents of the heart.

author: Hebrews 12:1
text: Wherefore seeing we also are compassed about with so great a cloud of witnesses, let us lay aside every weight, and the sin which doth so easily beset us, and let us run with patience the race that is set before us,

author: Hebrews 12:2
text: Looking unto Jesus the author and finisher of our faith; who for the joy that was set before him endured the cross, despising the shame, and is set down at the right hand of the throne of God.

author: Leviticus 19:18
text: Thou shalt not avenge, nor bear any grudge against the children of thy people, but thou shalt love thy neighbour as thyself: I am the Lord.

author: Numbers 6:24
text: The Lord bless thee, and keep thee:

author: Numbers 6:25
text: The Lord make his face shine upon thee, and be gracious unto thee:

author: Numbers 6:26
text: The Lord lift up his countenance upon thee, and give thee peace.

author: Numbers 23:19
text: God is not a man, that he should lie; neither the son of man, that he should repent: hath he said, and shall he not do it? or hath he spoken, and shall he not make it good?

author: Deuteronomy 4:29
text: But if from thence thou shalt seek the Lord thy God, thou shalt find him, if thou seek him with all thy heart and with all thy soul.

author: Deuteronomy 6:5
text: And thou shalt love the Lord thy God with all thine heart, and with all thy soul, and with all thy might.

author: Deuteronomy 31:6
text: Be strong and of a good courage, fear not, nor be afraid of them: for the Lord thy God, he it is that doth go with thee; he will not fail thee, nor forsake thee.

author: Deuteronomy 31:8
text: And the Lord, he it is that doth go before thee; he will be with thee, he will not fail thee, neither forsake thee: fear not, neither be dismayed.

author: Ruth 1:16
text: And Ruth said, Intreat me not to leave thee, or to return from following after thee: for whither thou goest, I will go; and where thou lodgest, I will lodge: thy people shall be my people, and thy God my God.

author: 1 Samuel 12:24
text: Only fear the Lord, and serve him in truth with all your heart: for consider how great things he hath done for you.

author: 1 Samuel 16:7
text: But the Lord said unto Samuel, Look not on his countenance, or on the height of his stature; because I have refused him: for the Lord seeth not as man seeth; for man looketh on the outward appearance, but the Lord looketh on the heart.

author: 2 Samuel 22:31
text: As for God, his way is perfect; the word of the Lord is tried: he is a buckler to all them that trust in him.

author: 1 Kings 8:56
text: Blessed be the Lord, that hath given rest unto his people Israel, according to all that he promised: there hath not failed one word of all his good promise, which he promised by the hand of Moses his servant.

author: 1 Chronicles 16:11
text: Seek the Lord and his strength, seek his face continually.

author: 1 Chronicles 16:34
text: O give thanks unto the Lord; for he is good; for his mercy endureth for ever.

author: 1 Chronicles 29:11
text: Thine, O Lord, is the greatness, and the power, and the glory, and the victory, and the majesty: for all that is in the heaven and in the earth is thine; thine is the kingdom, O Lord, and thou art exalted as head above all.

author: 2 Chronicles 7:14
text: If my people, which are called by my name, shall humble themselves, and pray, and seek my face, and turn from their wicked ways; then will I hear from heaven, and will forgive their sin, and will heal their land.

author: 2 Chronicles 20:15
text: And he said, Hearken ye, all Judah, and ye inhabitants of Jerusalem, and thou king Jehoshaphat, Thus saith the Lord unto you, Be not afraid nor dismayed by reason of this great multitude; for the battle is not yours, but God's.

author: Ezra 8:22
text: The hand of our God is upon all them for good that seek him; but his power and his wrath is against all them that forsake him.

author: Nehemiah 8:10
text: Then he said unto them, Go your way, eat the fat, and drink the sweet, and send portions unto them for whom nothing is prepared: for this day is holy unto our Lord: neither be ye sorry; for the joy of the Lord is your strength.

author: Esther 4:14
text: And who knoweth whether thou art come to the kingdom for such a time as this?

author: Job 1:21
text: And said, Naked came I out of my mother's womb, and naked shall I return thither: the Lord gave, and the Lord hath taken away; blessed be the name of the Lord.

author: Job 19:25
text: For I know that my redeemer liveth, and that he shall stand at the latter day upon the earth.

author: Job 23:10
text: But he knoweth the way that I take: when he hath tried me, I shall come forth as gold.

author: Joel 2:12
text: Therefore also now, saith the Lord, turn ye even to me with all your heart, and with fasting, and with weeping, and with mourning.

author: Joel 2:25
text: And I will restore to you the years that the locust hath eaten.

author: Joel 2:28
text: And it shall come to pass afterward, that I will pour out my spirit upon all flesh; and your sons and your daughters shall prophesy, your old men shall dream dreams, your young men shall see visions.

author: Habakkuk 3:17
text: Although the fig tree shall not blossom, neither shall fruit be in the vines; the labour of the olive shall fail, and the fields shall yield no meat; the flock shall be cut off from the fold, and there shall be no herd in the stalls:

author: Habakkuk 3:18
text: Yet I will rejoice in the Lord, I will joy in the God of my salvation.

author: Habakkuk 3:19
text: The Lord God is my strength, and he will make my feet like hinds' feet, and he will make me to walk upon mine high places.

author: Zephaniah 3:17
text: The Lord thy God in the midst of thee is mighty; he will save, he will rejoice over thee with joy; he will rest in his love, he will joy over thee with singing.

author: Zechariah 4:6
text: Then he answered and spake unto me, saying, This is the word of the Lord unto Zerubbabel, saying, Not by might, nor by power, but by my spirit, saith the Lord of hosts.

author: Malachi 3:10
text: Bring ye all the tithes into the storehouse, that there may be meat in mine house, and prove me now herewith, saith the Lord of hosts, if I will not open you the windows of heaven, and pour you out a blessing, that there shall not be room enough to receive it.

author: Matthew 10:28
text: And fear not them which kill the body, but are not able to kill the soul: but rather fear him which is able to destroy both soul and body in hell.

author: Matthew 16:24
text: Then said Jesus unto his disciples, If any man will come after me, let him deny himself, and take up his cross, and follow me.

author: Mark 10:45
text: For even the Son of man came not to be ministered unto, but to minister, and to give his life a ransom for many.

author: Luke 2:10
text: And the angel said unto them, Fear not: for, behold, I bring you good tidings of great joy, which shall be to all people.

author: Luke 2:11
text: For unto you is born this day in the city of David a Saviour, which is Christ the Lord.

author: Luke 12:32
text: Fear not, little flock; for it is your Father's good pleasure to give you the kingdom.

author: John 5:24
text: Verily, verily, I say unto you, He that heareth my word, and believeth on him that sent me, hath everlasting life, and shall not come into condemnation; but is passed from death unto life.

author: John 6:35
text: And Jesus said unto them, I am the bread of life: he that cometh to me shall never hunger; and he that believeth on me shall never thirst.

author: John 16:13
text: Howbeit when he, the Spirit of truth, is come, he will guide you into all truth: for he shall not speak of himself; but whatsoever he shall hear, that shall he speak: and he will shew you things to come.

author: Acts 17:28
text: For in him we live, and move, and have our being; as certain also of your own poets have said, For we are also his offspring.

author: Romans 4:20
text: He staggered not at the promise of God through unbelief; but was strong in faith, giving glory to God;

author: Romans 8:18
text: For I reckon that the sufferings of this present time are not worthy to be compared with the glory which shall be revealed in us.

author: Romans 15:13
text: Now the God of hope fill you with all joy and peace in believing, that ye may abound in hope, through the power of the Holy Ghost.

author: 1 Corinthians 1:18
text: For the preaching of the cross is to them that perish foolishness; but unto us which are saved it is the power of God.

author: 1 Corinthians 15:57
text: But thanks be to God, which giveth us the victory through our Lord Jesus Christ.

author: 2 Corinthians 4:16
text: For which cause we faint not; but though our outward man perish, yet the inward man is renewed day by day.

author: 2 Corinthians 4:17
text: For our light affliction, which is but for a moment, worketh for us a far more exceeding and eternal weight of glory;

author: 2 Corinthians 4:18
text: While we look not at the things which are seen, but at the things which are not seen: for the things which are seen are temporal; but the things which are not seen are eternal.

author: 2 Corinthians 5:21
text: For he hath made him to be sin for us, who knew no sin; that we might be made the righteousness of God in him.

author: 2 Corinthians 9:7
text: Every man according as he purposeth in his heart, so let him give; not grudgingly, or of necessity: for God loveth a cheerful giver.

author: 2 Corinthians 12:10
text: Therefore I take pleasure in infirmities, in reproaches, in necessities, in persecutions, in distresses for Christ's sake: for when I am weak, then am I strong.

author: Galatians 5:1
text: Stand fast therefore in the liberty wherewith Christ hath made us free, and be not entangled again with the yoke of bondage.

author: Galatians 6:7
text: Be not deceived; God is not mocked: for whatsoever a man soweth, that shall he also reap.

author: Ephesians 3:20
text: Now unto him that is able to do exceeding abundantly above all that we ask or think, according to the power that worketh in us,

author: Ephesians 4:26
text: Be ye angry, and sin not: let not the sun go down upon your wrath:

author: Ephesians 4:29
text: Let no corrupt communication proceed out of your mouth, but that which is good to the use of edifying, that it may minister grace unto the hearers.

author: Ephesians 5:1
text: Be ye therefore followers of God, as dear children;

author: Ephesians 6:10
text: Finally, my brethren, be strong in the Lord, and in the power of his might.

author: Ephesians 6:11
text: Put on the whole armour of God, that ye may be able to stand against the wiles of the devil.

author: Philippians 2:3
text: Let nothing be done through strife or vainglory; but in lowliness of mind let each esteem other better than themselves.

author: Philippians 2:4
text: Look not every man on his own things, but every man also on the things of others.

author: Philippians 2:5
text: Let this mind be in you, which was also in Christ Jesus:

author: Philippians 3:13
text: Brethren, I count not myself to have apprehended: but this one thing I do, forgetting those things which are behind, and reaching forth unto those things which are before,

author: Philippians 3:14
text: I press toward the mark for the prize of the high calling of God in Christ Jesus.

author: Colossians 3:2
text: Set your affection on things above, not on things on the earth.

author: Colossians 3:12
text: Put on therefore, as the elect of God, holy and beloved, bowels of mercies, kindness, humbleness of mind, meekness, longsuffering;

author: Colossians 3:13
text: Forbearing one another, and forgiving one another, if any man have a quarrel against any: even as Christ forgave you, so also do ye.

author: Colossians 3:14
text: And above all these things put on charity, which is the bond of perfectness.

author: Colossians 3:15
text: And let the peace of God rule in your hearts, to the which also ye are called in one body; and be ye thankful.

author: Colossians 3:17
text: And whatsoever ye do in word or deed, do all in the name of the Lord Jesus, giving thanks to God and the Father by him.

author: 1 Thessalonians 5:11
text: Wherefore comfort yourselves together, and edify one another, even as also ye do.

author: 2 Thessalonians 3:3
text: But the Lord is faithful, who shall stablish you, and keep you from evil.

author: 2 Thessalonians 3:13
text: But ye, brethren, be not weary in well doing.

author: 1 Timothy 4:12
text: Let no man despise thy youth; but be thou an example of the believers, in word, in conversation, in charity, in spirit, in faith, in purity.

author: 1 Timothy 6:6
text: But godliness with contentment is great gain.

author: 1 Timothy 6:10
text: For the love of money is the root of all evil: which while some coveted after, they have erred from the faith, and pierced themselves through with many sorrows.

author: 1 Timothy 6:12
text: Fight the good fight of faith, lay hold on eternal life, whereunto thou art also called, and hast professed a good profession before many witnesses.

author: 2 Timothy 2:15
text: Study to shew thyself approved unto God, a workman that needeth not to be ashamed, rightly dividing the word of truth.

author: 2 Timothy 4:7
text: I have fought a good fight, I have finished my course, I have kept the faith:

author: Titus 2:11
text: For the grace of God that bringeth salvation hath appeared to all men,

author: Hebrews 4:16
text: Let us therefore come boldly unto the throne of grace, that we may obtain mercy, and find grace to help in time of need.

author: Hebrews 10:24
text: And let us consider one another to provoke unto love and to good works:

author: Hebrews 10:25
text: Not forsaking the assembling of ourselves together, as the manner of some is; but exhorting one another: and so much the more, as ye see the day approaching.

author: Hebrews 11:6
text: But without faith it is impossible to please him: for he that cometh to God must believe that he is, and that he is a rewarder of them that diligently seek him.

author: Hebrews 13:5
text: Let your conversation be without covetousness; and be content with such things as ye have: for he hath said, I will never leave thee, nor forsake thee.

author: Hebrews 13:16
text: But to do good and to communicate forget not: for with such sacrifices God is well pleased.

author: James 1:2
text: My brethren, count it all joy when ye fall into divers temptations;

author: James 1:12
text: Blessed is the man that endureth temptation: for when he is tried, he shall receive the crown of life, which the Lord hath promised to them that love him.

author: James 1:17
text: Every good gift and every perfect gift is from above, and cometh down from the Father of lights, with whom is no variableness, neither shadow of turning.

author: James 1:19
text: Wherefore, my beloved brethren, let every man be swift to hear, slow to speak, slow to wrath:

author: James 1:22
text: But be ye doers of the word, and not hearers only, deceiving your own selves.

author: James 2:17
text: Even so faith, if it hath not works, is dead, being alone.

author: James 5:16
text: Confess your faults one to another, and pray one for another, that ye may be healed. The effectual fervent prayer of a righteous man availeth much.

author: 1 Peter 2:9
text: But ye are a chosen generation, a royal priesthood, an holy nation, a peculiar people; that ye should shew forth the praises of him who hath called you out of darkness into his marvellous light:

author: 1 Peter 3:15
text: But sanctify the Lord God in your hearts: and be ready always to give an answer to every man that asketh you a reason of the hope that is in you with meekness and fear:

author: 1 Peter 4:8
text: And above all things have fervent charity among yourselves: for charity shall cover the multitude of sins.

author: 1 Peter 5:8
text: Be sober, be vigilant; because your adversary the devil, as a roaring lion, walketh about, seeking whom he may devour:

author: 1 Peter 5:10
text: But the God of all grace, who hath called us unto his eternal glory by Christ Jesus, after that ye have suffered a while, make you perfect, stablish, strengthen, settle you.

author: 2 Peter 3:9
text: The Lord is not slack concerning his promise, as some men count slackness; but is longsuffering to us-ward, not willing that any should perish, but that all should come to repentance.

author: 1 John 3:1
text: Behold, what manner of love the Father hath bestowed upon us, that we should be called the sons of God: therefore the world knoweth us not, because it knew him not.

author: 1 John 3:18
text: My little children, let us not love in word, neither in tongue; but in deed and in truth.

author: 1 John 4:7
text: Beloved, let us love one another: for love is of God; and every one that loveth is born of God, and knoweth God.

author: 1 John 4:10
text: Herein is love, not that we loved God, but that he loved us, and sent his Son to be the propitiation for our sins.

author: 1 John 4:18
text: There is no fear in love; but perfect love casteth out fear: because fear hath torment. He that feareth is not made perfect in love.

author: 1 John 5:4
text: For whatsoever is born of God overcometh the world: and this is the victory that overcometh the world, even our faith.

author: 1 John 5:14
text: And this is the confidence that we have in him, that, if we ask any thing according to his will, he heareth us:

author: 2 John 1:6
text: And this is love, that we walk after his commandments. This is the commandment, That, as ye have heard from the beginning, ye should walk in it.

author: 3 John 1:2
text: Beloved, I wish above all things that thou mayest prosper and be in health, even as thy soul prospereth.

author: Jude 1:21
text: Keep yourselves in the love of God, looking for the mercy of our Lord Jesus Christ unto eternal life.

author: Jude 1:24
text: Now unto him that is able to keep you from falling, and to present you faultless before the presence of his glory with exceeding joy,

author: Revelation 1:8
text: I am Alpha and Omega, the beginning and the ending, saith the Lord, which is, and which was, and which is to come, the Almighty.

author: Revelation 3:20
text: Behold, I stand at the door, and knock: if any man hear my voice, and open the door, I will come in to him, and will sup with him, and he with me.

author: Revelation 21:3
text: And I heard a great voice out of heaven saying, Behold, the tabernacle of God is with men, and he will dwell with them, and they shall be his people, and God himself shall be with them, and be their God.

author: Revelation 22:12
text: And, behold, I come quickly; and my reward is with me, to give every man according as his work shall be.

author: Revelation 22:21
text: The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you all. Amen.
